Sinbad.Action: Stands firm and alert at the wheel, confidently sensing something in the fog, showing leadership and calm presence.
Communicates clearly and respectfully with Harufa, the first mate, acknowledging his role and information.
No explicit action showing neglect or dismissiveness toward crew hardships despite indication of their worn and gaunt state.
Stands erect, holds the wheel firmly, and peers into the fog with focused attention.
Orders a sounding for depth despite it being an unexpected or unusual location, demonstrating initiative and awareness.
Persists in his observations despite crew skepticism and apparent hardship, showing confidence and resolve.
Calls sharp lookout aloft, actively involves crew in vigilance.
Peers hard to starboard and announces land.
Commands to take in all sail, showing leadership and trust in crew's abilities.
Calls out to maintain sharp lookout and navigates carefully toward land despite fog and darkness.
Identifies 'Land ho' confidently and orders to take in all sail.
Turns the wheel over to Harufa and gives clear instructions to drop anchor at first light
Expresses hope sincerely for finding food and water, invoking a blessing
Knocks softly on the Princess's door at night and insists gently on speaking with her, bringing good news
Uses a good-natured smile and a gentle physical gesture (elbow) to prevent the waiting-woman from closing the door
Smiles and calls after Sadi in a friendly manner.
Jokes gallantly about inventing a whole continent for a kiss from Parisa.
Invites Parisa to their wedding in a warm, inclusive way.
Allows Parisa’s affectionate gesture despite Sadi's disapproval, showing tolerance.
Confidently informs crew about anchoring off an island and plans for resupplying and continuing voyage.
Lightheartedly handles tension between Parisa and Sadi with humor and charm.
Displays leadership by confidently addressing the situation and reassuring his companions about next steps.
Absent from the scene as sailors on the island joke and share food, showing camaraderie; others express desire for Sinbad to return, suggesting he is missed and possibly trusted.
Absent from scene, left the crew marooned but managed provisions for multiple voyages.
Carries water cask and weapon while leading others through unfamiliar terrain, remains alert to surroundings.
Observes and identifies a large footprint as 'a cloven hoof', showing knowledge of potential dangers.
Impressed by mysterious footprints and pursues their origin with curiosity, sharing the discovery with companions.
Offers Harufa his water cask before investigating the stone mouth alone.
Decides to explore the dangerous cave mouth despite warnings and unknown risks.
Commands the group to move quickly to the boat to rescue Sokurah.
Throws a javelin at the Cyclops to protect Sokurah.
Runs to physically knock the Cyclops over, enabling Sokurah to escape.
Drags the fallen Harufa out of the path of the advancing Cyclops
Hacks at the Cyclops alongside Ali to protect the men
Drags the fallen Harufa out of the path of the advancing Cyclops.
Struggles with the groggy Harufa and asks for help to ensure his safety.
Dips a cloth on Harufa's aching head to comfort him.
Smiles when Sokurah discreetly draws the lamp away from him.
Drags the fallen Harufa out of the path of the advancing Cyclops, showing quick thinking and concern for others.
Struggles with the groggy Harufa and calls for help, effectively organizing support.
Offers comfort to Harufa by dipping a cloth on his aching head, showing attentiveness and calm under pressure.
Smiles when Sokurah discreetly keeps the lamp away, indicating awareness of delicate social dynamics.
Questions Sokurah about why the lamp’s Genie did not destroy the monster, showing curiosity and critical thinking.
Joins the crew in swimming toward the ship, towing half-drowned Sokurah with him.
Helps the coughing, half-drowned Sokurah up onto the deck and pulls him up over the rail.
Comforts Parisa with a smile, gently pulls her off his neck while focusing on crew safety.
Shouts orders to crew to hoist sails and head for deep water to ensure everyone's safety.
Offers Sokurah a glass of rum and takes him to his cabin to recover after drowning.
Sits with crew members and shares strategic concerns about the Cyclops and dangers ahead openly.
Pushes the jewels across the table toward Sokurah without hesitation despite being impressed, indicating restraint and honesty.
Rebukes Sokurah by saying his ambition has nearly cost their lives.
Questions Sokurah about his identity and motives in a straightforward manner, showing a cautious and sincere approach.
Pushes the jewels back to Sokurah without hesitation, showing discernment and restraint despite temptation.
Recognizes that Sokurah's ambition nearly cost them their lives, demonstrating awareness and critical judgment.
Clearly articulates the priority of their mission for the Caliph, showing focus and responsibility.
Expresses firm commitment to the mission despite potential risks, prioritizing peace and duty.
Smiles and invites Sokurah warmly to his quarters, showing courtesy and friendliness.
Commands to run up the pennant so riders may be dispatched, fostering good relations and communication with Bagdad.
Smiles happily during the joyful welcome, modestly credits peace to the news he brings, expresses sincere love for Parisa beyond political reasons
Leads Parisa to greet the Caliph with dignity, bringing peace between kingdoms
Orders riders to quickly bring news to Bagdad, leading to a joyful welcome and peace celebration.
Demonstrates modesty and diplomacy when speaking about his role in averting war.
Successfully negotiates peace between kingdoms, earning praise from the Caliph.
Leads Princess Parisa to greet the Caliph and introduces her respectfully as a symbol of lasting friendship between kingdoms.
Accepts the Caliph’s warm welcome and engages sincerely in conversation about his voyage.
Leads Parisa to greet the Caliph and represents his kingdom diplomatically, successfully averting a war and securing a royal wedding alliance.
Responds confidently to the Caliph, showing clear awareness of the political significance of his marriage to Princess Parisa.
Expresses skepticism about risking a ship and crew to Colossa, calling it madness.
Expresses clear and confident judgment by calling sailing back to Colossa mad, showing knowledge of the dangers.
Influences the Caliph decisively when the Caliph says 'Sinbad's word is my word,' indicating trust in Sinbad's opinion.
Does not directly challenge Sokurah's new weapon design, but skeptical of the plan to return to Colossa, showing discernment.
No evidence of confusion or hesitation confronting Sokurah’s plan, shows confidence and skill in judgment.
Seated calmly beside Sultan and Caliph during banquet, showing composure in high-status environment.
Does not intervene or comment while Sokurah the Magician is introduced and prepares his mystical act.
Sits very close to Parisa, puts his arm around her, provides comforting physical closeness as she rests her head on his shoulder.
Has his arm around Parisa, allowing her to rest her head on his shoulder, sharing a tender moment.
Comforts Parisa by putting his arm around her and sharing hopeful thoughts about their future happily and confidently.
Allows himself to be distracted at an important moment (wedding is tomorrow), possibly showing lack of focus or distraction.
Leaps across the table, kicks over the brazier of glowing coals, and hurls the magician to the floor to protect the princess from fear.
Turns to the Caliph and the Sultan calmly after disrupting the magician's spell.
Leaps across the table, kicks over the brazier of glowing coals, and hurls the magician to the floor, breaking an evil spell and restoring safety.
Embraces Parisa protectively at the wedding toast.
Leads Parisa to her chambers and gently holds her hands, expressing a wish for the night to last longer.
Shares a tender and sincere moment with Parisa, softly kissing her goodnight.
Embraces Parisa protectively after the Caliph’s toast.
Leads Parisa safely to her chamber and says goodnight with care.
Reflects thoughtfully on the magician’s prophecy during a personal moment.
Impatiently pounds on Princess Parisa's door and breaks the lock to rescue her without hesitation.
Shows immediate concern and urgency upon learning the princess is unresponsive.
Immediately reacts to the urgent situation, runs swiftly to Princess Parisa's locked chamber, attempts to break the lock with physical force.
Quickly locates Princess Parisa in an unexpected situation (miniaturized on the pillow), shows alertness and presence of mind.
Rubs his eyes and initially reacts with disbelief to Parisa's transformation, then emotionally accepts the reality.
Kneels beside Parisa's bed and faces the unfolding situation calmly as others enter, showing composure.
Turns sadly toward tiny Parisa and meets the Sultan and Caliph, indicating emotional involvement but no evident active problem-solving.
Instructs Sadi to keep close watch on his mistress, showing concern for her safety.
Rises quickly and runs through the corridors urgently, showing commitment to intervene or act in a crisis.
Rises quickly and commands Sadi to keep his mistress in sight, showing promptness and decisiveness.
Runs swiftly through palace corridors to locate the magician, demonstrating urgency and purposeful action.
Checks with the guard about the magician’s whereabouts and immediately pursues him, showing resourcefulness and determination.
Urgently seeks Sokurah to find help for Princess Parisa despite the risks involved.
Promises to answer to the Caliph for Sokurah’s safety, showing trustworthiness and responsibility.
Quickly involves Sokurah and acts decisively to help the princess without hesitation.
Determinedly insists on taking a month to help the princess recover, showing commitment and hope.
Challenges the Sultan's harsh attitude and expresses willingness to sacrifice himself.
Confidently accepts the Sultan's challenge to heal Parisa within one month.
Expresses gratitude to the Sultan and carefully takes Parisa, showing responsibility and care.
Immediately requests the necessary actions to remove the evil charm without hesitation.
Agrees to undertake a dangerous voyage to help remove an evil charm, showing commitment to the Caliph and Sokurah's urgent needs.
Considers involving the Princess in the dangerous journey based on Sokurah's advice, indicating respect for counsel and concern for proper procedure.
Plans to gather a crew from prisoners who face harsh conditions under a cruel headman, demonstrating willingness to trust and rely on marginalized or fearful men.
Realizes the necessity of acquiring the giant bird's egg shell and volunteers to sail to get it despite the danger.
Plans to bring the princess along despite dangers, showing understanding of potion requirements and stakes.
Prepares to assemble a crew including former brave men and plans to recruit even from dangerous places like prisons.
Consults Sokurah about the need for the giant crossbow and palace jeweler for princess transport.
Steps forward to offer freedom to hardened prisoners, appealing to their courage.
Acknowledges the prisoners' hardened nature but still believes in their potential for freedom.
Steps forward confidently to offer freedom to prisoners for joining his dangerous voyage.
Is met with disbelief and scorn by hardened prisoners but continues undeterred.
Offers a full pardon to the prisoners, giving them a choice between freedom or death.
Shows trust by standing alive after fighting the Cyclops and vouching for Harufa who fought at his side.
Patiently waits while prisoners discuss and ultimately join him voluntarily, indicating tolerance and respect for their decision.
Offers prisoners a full pardon and presents a clear choice between freedom and death, showing confidence and leadership.
Points out his own survival after fighting the Cyclops and vouches for Harufa's loyalty, demonstrating credibility and strategic persuasion.
Carefully prepares to select the crew, responding effectively to prisoners' reactions and gaining their trust, indicating skillful negotiation and command.
Encourages crew by emphasizing courage as the only virtue required.
Responds to Caliph's critique with a tight smile, not bitterness.
Accepts the Caliph's fatherly gesture and speaks respectfully to him.
Expresses concern for Parisa’s comfort and safety during a dangerous voyage.
Acknowledges the danger and difficulties ahead, showing sincerity and transparency.
Carefully studies the map and acknowledges the dangers ahead, including uncharted waters and a doubtful crew.
Expresses concern about the difficulty of the voyage and the dangers involved, demonstrating awareness and forethought.
Expresses distrust of others without clear cause, showing deep foreboding in his eyes.
Expresses distrust and caution about others by saying 'I do not trust them out of my sight' with deep foreboding in his eyes.
Locks all weapons away after hearing about unrest among the crew, demonstrating precaution and planning.
Acts calmly and confidently when confronted by Sokurah, showing control over the situation.
Relies on searching men and disarming them to prevent mutiny, indicating practical security measures.
Does not engage in confrontation or negotiation with the potential mutineers beyond disarming the crew.
Puts down food as appetite is troubled, shows awareness of approaching danger and prepares to act.
Leaps up quickly in response to disturbance, overturning his chair but prioritizing urgent action.
Places hand gently to comfort Parisa, showing calm and confidence in personal interactions despite tension.
Leaps aside to avoid falling mutineers, uses a chair defensively against Golar, fights bravely against multiple assailants.
Delivers a stunning blow to Golar to protect himself, then pockets Parisa's jewelled case before running for safety.
Leaps safely aside to avoid falling mutineers, uses a chair as a weapon, draws his sword quickly, and engages multiple assailants skillfully.
Runs one of the men through and is about to finish the second, demonstrating effective combat skill.
Delivers a stunning blow to Golar just in time when Golar is distracted and about to attack.
Picks up and pockets the jewelled case before escaping, showing awareness and resourcefulness.
Hurls himself into the fight to help faithful men against mutineers.
Stops the fight by ordering surrender and throws down his sword to prevent further violence.
Commands to spare Sokurah's life despite danger.
Hurls himself into the fight, slashes a rope to drop a sail canvas on mutineers, helping to rout them.
Commands the mutiny to stop and surrenders when outmatched, shows control and judgment in tense situation.
Allows himself and loyal crew to be disarmed by the mutineers without further resistance.
Remains composed and silent while condemned by mutineers and leader Kharim.
Endures the mutineers' threats calmly without panic or rash reaction.
Relies on faithfulness of his loyal crew to face dangerous odds.
Remains passive and allows others to be roughly handled and taken as captives without intervening visibly.
Stops his men from killing Sokurah despite opposition and harsh circumstances.
Engages in calm dialogue with Sokurah and shows curiosity by asking 'What makes you so certain?'.
Stops Harufa and others from killing Sokurah to save a man who babbles nonsense, showing restraint and consideration.
Questions Sokurah to understand his certainty about the prophecy, demonstrating inquiry and desire to grasp the situation fully.
Looks at Harufa tolerantly and offers a practical solution by waxing cloth to block out the wailing sound.
Remains steady and attentive amid rising dangers, discussing the situation clearly with companions despite low visibility and rough conditions.
Removes his cloak and carefully wraps it several times around the jewel box containing Parisa, protecting it amid the worsening conditions.
Immediately responds to the crewman's warning by rushing to take action with Sokurah and Harufa, showing concern and readiness to help.
Rushing immediately to respond to the danger of the ship heading toward jagged rocks, showing quick reaction and leadership.
No indication of hesitation or confusion when alerted; acts decisively with others.
Seizes the wheel and takes charge during the crisis, issuing clear instructions to crew members to ensure their safety.
Responds promptly to Sokuran's warning by turning the wheel quickly to avoid danger.
Holds the ship steady under strain, showing responsibility towards crew safety.
Shows great personal strain but maintains composure to help navigate through danger.
Responds promptly to Sokuran's warning by quickly turning the wheel to the right to avoid danger.
Whirls the wheel to the left and holds steadily despite great strain, successfully navigating near jagged rocks.
Grits his teeth and closes his eyes for a moment, fighting the intense sound but continuing to steer.
Rouses the exhausted crewmen, encouraging them to get back to work.
Orders that the mutiny leader be wrapped and thrown overboard.
Rouses the exhausted crewmen and motivates them to regain consciousness and alertness after adversity.
Secures the weapons of the mutinous crewmen by locking them away, demonstrating control over the situation.
Orders to tie and throw the mutiny leader overboard, decisively quelling the mutiny threat.
Gives clear navigation orders to the helmsman with a sharp lookout for dangers ahead.
Claps Harufa warmly on the shoulder and explains why he must stay behind, showing appreciation and kindness.
Gives orders to keep men at the weapon at all times, demonstrating responsibility but not necessarily warmth.
Directs the crew to keep the men at the weapon at all times, showing awareness and caution.
Decides to leave Harufa behind because he is more valuable there, demonstrating good judgment and delegation.
Shows warmth and confidence when interacting with Harufa and Sokurah, suggesting leadership qualities.
Leads the men cautiously through the tunnel despite their visible tenseness and fear.
Looks meaningfully at Sokurah before moving toward the stone head, showing a gesture of connection or communication.
Does not visibly reprimand or dismiss the nervous men following him, allowing them to follow at their own pace.
Looks up at the night sky, takes a meaningful look at Sokurah, then confidently moves off toward the stone head, leading the men despite visible tenseness.
Leads the men safely through a dark, tense tunnel, showing calmness despite potential danger (falling rock, nervous men).
Agrees with Sokurah's plan, showing cooperation and trust in team strategy.
Looks at Sokurah in suspicious surprise upon hearing the plan.
Agrees with Sokurah’s tactical plan to separate into two smaller groups to avoid detection and to facilitate rescue if one group is captured.
Shows suspicious surprise at Sokurah's suggestion but ultimately accepts it, indicating some caution mixed with open-mindedness.
Takes initiative to signal and lead his group off on the agreed plan promptly.
Whispers to his men to wait while he moves off alone toward a faint sound.
Gazes carefully at the environment, noticing details like the overscale barbecue and other evidence of the Cyclops.
Whispers instructions to his men to wait while he investigates a faint sound alone.
Quietly reassures Harufa not to be afraid, calming him when he is terrified.
Questions Harufa with a concerned glance, showing attentiveness.
Insists on leaving before the Cyclops returns, prioritizing safety of the group.
Responds quickly to Harufa's shout and runs to help, follows him behind the waterfall without hesitation.
Stops in amazement to look at the treasure rather than immediately grabbing some for himself.
Moves about noiselessly and carefully while searching for missing men, demonstrating cautious and skillful behavior.
Responds immediately and runs toward Harufa's urgent call, showing alertness and decisiveness.

Stops in amazement at the vast treasure hoard instead of immediately taking inventory or managing the situation.
Stops the men from taking treasure before completing the mission, prioritizing safety and duty over greed.
Physically assaults crewmen to enforce his command, threatening violence.
Commands the men to flee the Cyclops quickly, showing protective leadership.

Allows the men to get trapped by the Cyclops after advancing toward treasure, underestimating the enemy's threat.
Stands ready to fight the Cyclops to the death, sword drawn, facing a great threat to protect his men.

Raises his sword and plunges it into the Cyclops's hand to protect himself and his men.
Shows grim awareness and calm in danger, explaining the Cyclops's actions to the men.
Suddenly attacks the Cyclops' hand with his sword when it reaches for him.
Allows himself to be grabbed and dropped into the cage by the Cyclops without reportedly escaping or resisting further.
Calmly assesses the situation inside the cage and grimly explains the Cyclops' intentions to the men.
Watches the cyclops' actions carefully and his eyes narrow with the dawn of a plan.
Asks for help to open the cage latch and tries to free himself and the men.
Softly encourages men to keep hope and plans escape despite danger.
Tells others to keep plans secret to protect the group.
Shows disappointment when Sokurah abandons them but focuses on escape.
Climbs the cage pole and tries to reach the latch to open the cage, actively seeking to escape captivity.
Notices Sokurah sneaking around and communicates quietly to coordinate escape plans, showing awareness and strategic thinking.
Calmly reassures crewmen about escaping despite danger, maintaining morale and secrecy.
Despite effort, fails to reach the latch on his own, indicating a limit of immediate physical capability in this moment.
Uses the tiny jeweled case containing Parisa to try and escape or solve a problem, carefully instructing Parisa on how to release the peg and stay hopeful despite difficulty.
Maintains calm and gives clear, reassuring instructions to Parisa, showing leadership and problem-solving under pressure.
Relies on Parisa, who struggles with the peg and cannot move it at first; while Sinbad supports her, he does not appear to have an immediate alternative plan visible in this excerpt.
Encourages his men with restrained joy and directs them to quickly escape the cage.
Reaches down to help the next man out of the cage after crawling out himself.
Directs his men quickly to lift him up and efficiently pushes open the cage lid, then helps others escape.
Shows restrained joy at the successful opening of the cage, maintaining composure.
Instructs Parisa to stand clear of the door, demonstrating situational awareness and leadership.
Encourages and reassures Harufa who is nearly exhausted, showing concern for his wellbeing.
Protects Parisa by placing her carefully in a jeweled case and carrying it securely.
Continues to untie Harufa despite danger nearby.
Runs to Sokurah and pulls him into safety after the attack.
Quickly responds to Sokurah being struck down by the cyclops by jumping down from the barbecue and running to his aid.
Pulls the fallen magician Sokurah into the safety of the rocks and assesses their situation, showing careful calculation.
Looks out through the small opening in the rocks calculating his chances with the cyclops, demonstrating situational awareness and strategic thinking.
Continues untieing Harufa despite the immediate danger of the cyclops approaching, showing focus and presence of mind.
Calculates his chances with the cyclops before making a move to retrieve the magic lamp.
Runs across the clearing to retrieve the lamp despite the danger posed by the cyclops.
Seizes a firebrand and strategically retreats to the safety of the rocks while facing the cyclops.
Dodges back into a narrow crevice and presses himself flat against the rock to avoid the cyclops' grasp.
Leaps from hiding and aggressively hurls the burning torch at the cyclops.
Comes out of hiding to watch the blinded cyclops, then rescues the weak and blackened Harufa by releasing him from the spit.
Throws himself between the cyclops and the magician, picking up a stick and beating the cyclops to protect Sokurah.
Distracts the cyclops by shouting and drawing its attention away from Sokurah, risking his own safety.
Hurls a burning torch at the cyclops, causing it to become blinded and fall.
Emerges cautiously and evaluates the situation after blinding the cyclops.
Releases Harufa and immediately notices danger to the magician, deciding to intervene.
Grabs a stick and beats the cyclops' leg to distract it and protect the magician.
Calls out to the cyclops and lures it away from the magician by drawing its attention to himself.
Climbs swiftly up the trail to escape the cyclops after successfully distracting it.
Climbs swiftly up a trail to evade the cyclops, uses a long pole to hit the cyclops and evade capture.
Leads the cyclops across the rocky plateau by making noise to keep it following him.
Pauses at edge of cliff and encourages cyclops verbally to keep following, showing control over the situation.
Jumps aside at the last moment and runs between the cyclops’s legs causing it to fall off the cliff.
Refuses to give Sokurah the lamp without trust, questions his motives for putting safety second to the lamp.
Accuses Sokurah of valuing the lamp more than their lives, showing distrust and confrontation.
Holds the lamp and questions Sokurah's trustworthiness, showing caution and awareness of others' motives.
Refuses to give the lamp without Sokurah providing the words to summon the genie, demonstrating strategic thinking and control over valuable resources.
Engages Sokurah in dialogue to clarify intentions and assess threats, indicating careful decision-making and interpersonal insight.
Assures protection by agreeing to keep the lamp safe despite not understanding its power.
Waves a gesture of warning to Sokurah about the rough trail.
Seizes Sokurah’s wrist and pulls him to safety after he steps on a loose rock.
Gives Sokurah a moment to recover after his narrow escape before leading again.
Passes out rations fairly and encourages men to give thanks despite scarce provisions.
Responds calmly to Rajan's bitterness without reprimand or confrontation.
Leads the men carefully up the difficult rocky trail, organizes rationing of scarce provisions, and maintains order during the dangerous climb.
Allows Rajan, who hesitates and is fearful, to attempt crossing a very narrow and dangerous ledge without intervening more actively to prevent the fatal fall.
Leads the group carefully up the rocks after a dangerous fall.
Observes and listens closely to the Roc's egg, showing presence of mind and curiosity.
Decides to acquire a piece of the eggshell despite potential danger.
Displays confidence and calmness when addressing the crew's fear and hunger.
Acknowledges the crew's hunger and inability to be controlled strictly; allows them to break and roast the egg despite potential consequences.
Hands part of the eggshell to Sokurah after the baby Roc is slain, sharing resources or symbolically including him.
Does not intervene to stop the crew from killing the baby bird despite his role as leader.
Recognizes that hungry men are difficult to control and allows them to break open the egg despite risks.
Takes initiative to break off a piece of the eggshell and gives it to Sokurah, facilitating resource use.
Does not stop the crewmen from attempting to kill the baby Roc, which could have been dangerous.
Reassures Princess Parisa by sharing good news about obtaining the eggshell for the potion.
Expresses distrust toward the magician, showing concern for others' safety.
Keeps his worries private, revealing a sad face despite speaking hopeful words.
Asks relevant questions about the task at hand, such as how long it will take to restore the princess, demonstrating engagement and foresight.
Shows caution and awareness by noting the danger of the Cyclops domain and questioning what protects the castle, indicating strategic thinking.
Carries the jeweled case containing a crucial item (the eggshell) and shares good news with Parisa, showing responsibility and effective communication.
Expresses distrust and concern about the magician and the secrecy around the magic lamp's power, revealing critical thinking and prudence.
Considers Parisa's idea seriously and agrees to let her try entering the lamp despite risks, showing trust and care.
Expresses concern for Parisa's safety and instructs her to call quickly if in trouble.
Considers Parisa's unusual suggestion carefully before agreeing, showing cautious judgment and willingness to adapt.
Expresses distrust of the magician and concern about relying on the magic lamp alone, demonstrating awareness and critical thinking.
Agrees to the risky plan but instructs Parisa to call him quickly if needed, showing responsible leadership and control.
Reacts with some incredulity to Parisa's idea, possibly indicating initial skepticism or lack of understanding.
Warns Parisa urgently to be careful while she is exploring the magic lamp.
Keeps watch attentively over the situation, showing worry but maintaining focus.
Glances toward the crewman laughing but quickly returns his attention to the lamp, indicating situational awareness.
Shows eagerness and trust by agreeing to help the Genie after hearing Parisa's report.
Impatient to know the secret of the lamp, presses Parisa for information.
Becomes alert immediately when mist issues from the lamp spout, shows readiness and attention to detail.
Impatiently demands information about the lamp's secret before hearing the full story.
Calmly negotiates and agrees to help the Genie before fully understanding details, showing willingness to cooperate strategically.
Draws his sword and springs to help defend the men against the huge bird.
Draws his sword and springs to help defend the men against the huge bird.
Runs into the scene slashing at the bird's neck, successfully causing it to drop the sailors.
Calls out sincerely to Parisa for help using the magic words during battle.
Focuses on fighting the giant bird to protect himself and others.
Slashes at the bird's neck to try and save his crewmates and himself.
Rubs the magic lamp and calls out for the genie using the magic words, attempting to control the situation through knowledge and preparation.
Repeatedly calls out for Parisa to use the magic words, showing awareness and coordination but ultimately fails to avoid the bird attacking him.
Turns momentarily toward Parisa and is caught off guard by the bird’s attack, allowing the beak to fasten on him.
Looks carefully for fallen crewmen to ensure the magician is not among them.
Sinks to a sitting position showing defeat but then regains hope and summons the Genie.
Makes a quick circuit of the clearing, checking the fallen crewmen to ensure the magician is not among them.
Pauses at the lookout point, thinks deeply, shows realization of what must have happened, experiences a wave of despair but then overcomes it.
Recalls the invocation words given by Parisa under pressure and uses them to summon the Genie effectively.
Initially struggles to recall the exact words and shakes his head, showing momentary difficulty.
Commands the Genie confidently after summoning him.
Asks how he will recognize the Genie’s meeting place, showing some uncertainty.
Watches the Genie dissolve with amazement but quickly seizes the lamp and secures it to his waist.
Moves quickly and skillfully down a narrow and difficult mountain trail, clinging to rock faces.
Pauses briefly, breathing hard but maintaining focus while observing surroundings carefully.
Follows the Genie carefully and stays close, showing cautious but confident movement near danger.
Is startled and impressed by the dragon but does not freeze or flee, instead continues to proceed with the guide.
Turns the large wheel steadily, winding the chain tightly, demonstrating practical skill and confidence.
Upon reaching the cave entrance, draws his sword and moves carefully past the struggling dragon, showing bravery and tactical awareness.
Operates the inside wheel to release the dragon from the chain, successfully completing the task.
Looks around the vast cavern in awe and amazement, standing bewildered and unsure where to begin his search, indicating some momentary uncertainty or lack of direction.
Listens carefully to Parisa's distant voice and moves quickly in the direction of the sound, showing attentiveness and concern.
Listens carefully to sounds and voices to locate Parisa, showing alertness and attention to his environment.
Crosses a dangerous natural arch over molten rock while remaining cautious, demonstrating bravery and calculated movement.
Pauses and considers before choosing a path at a cavern division, indicating thoughtful decision-making.
Hurries down the cavern path following a louder voice, showing confidence and decisiveness in pursuing his goal.
Asks Parisa if she is harmed, shows concern for her wellbeing.
Refuses to give the lamp to Sokurah until the safety of their ship and people is ensured.

Reacts with amazement and increasing joy when Parisa begins to return to her full size, showing care and positive emotions towards her.
Keeps watch closely over Sokurah while the magical procedure is performed, holding his sword ready and showing protective vigilance.
Expresses a clear and firm warning to Sokurah about harming Parisa, demonstrating assertiveness and control in a tense situation.
Reacts with amazement and visible joy when Parisa is restored, showing emotional investment and recognition of success.

Pushes Parisa aside to a position of safety during the skeleton attack.
Commands Parisa to run to safety while he fights the skeleton.

Maintains composure and fighting ability while being forced backward by a relentless, magically animated skeleton.

Fights fiercely against the skeleton to protect himself and others

Chains Sokurah securely to prevent further harm.

Throws Nis’ sword precisely to pin Sokurah to the heavy door preventing escape.
Calmly chains Sokurah securely to a rock pedestal, ensuring he cannot move or resist.
Confidently confronts Sokurah verbally and physically, displaying control over the situation.
Replaces his sword carefully in its scabbard after securing Sokurah, showing prudence and readiness.
Takes Parisa’s arm and moves off quickly after securing Sokurah, indicating decisiveness and awareness to avoid further conflict.
Seizes the golden rope and encourages Parisa to hold tight while swinging across the broken bridge.
Seizes the end of the golden rope and swings across the broken arch to safety with Parisa.
Immediately assesses the danger of being trapped after the arch collapse and responds with decisive action.
Accepts Parisa's decision to destroy the lamp despite risking losing the Genie's help, showing respect for her promise.
Leads the way toward the cave mouth, holding Parisa's hand reassuringly with his sword drawn.
Pauses thoughtfully before agreeing to Parisa's promise, demonstrating consideration and respect for commitments despite risks.
Leads the way out with sword drawn, confidently taking charge in a dangerous situation.
Seizes Parisa's hand to guide and protect her from danger
Runs back into the cave towards the dragon to face danger rather than abandoning Parisa
Works swiftly to break the lock mechanism to free the chain and release the dragon.
Pauses with Parisa to watch the battle between the dragon and cyclops with awe.
Raises his sword and breaks the wooden lock mechanism with three blows, freeing the chain winch.
Watches the dragon and cyclops fight from a safe distance before quickly moving toward the cave entrance with Parisa.
Does not intervene directly in the fight between dragon and cyclops, instead chooses to observe and then retreat.
Supports Parisa when she leans on him in exhaustion; lifts her when she stumbles and moves off quickly to protect her.
Urgently instructs Ali to take the Princess to safety, prioritizing others' wellbeing.
Supports the exhausted Parisa by lifting her and moving off quickly despite his own exhaustion.
Commands Ali to take the Princess to safety while he prepares the giant crossbow.
Exhorts the men into action by commanding 'Pull! Pull for your lives!'
Cuts the rope holding the giant crossbow string taut, releasing an arrow that kills the dragon.
Does not panic despite the dragon's sudden appearance and the men dropping the ropes and running away.
Embraces Parisa warmly upon rescue and helps her up onto the ship's deck, ensuring her safety.
Calls instructions to crew to sail away promptly after ensuring everyone's safe.
Listens attentively to Parisa's regrets, showing concern for others' feelings.
Crawls down from the crossbow and quickly moves to the longboat after the dragon falls.
Runs toward Parisa and embraces her, then they both head swiftly to the longboat, showing leadership and concern for allies.
Helps Parisa onto the ship's deck and commands crew to prepare sails, demonstrating hands-on leadership and quick decision-making.
No hesitation or confusion shown after the dragon's fall; acts confidently to ensure escape and safety.
Smiles warmly and puts a friendly arm around the Genie's shoulder, praises him sincerely.
Laughs together with Parisa and Barani, celebrating their companionship.
Reacting with amazement to the Genie’s arrival and treasure but confidently embracing the situation, smiling warmly and encouraging Barani.
Refers to Barani’s transition from genie to cabin boy with a friendly attitude and gives positive reinforcement.
